content:
Diagnosis:	Solid pseudopapillary neoplasm of pancreatic tail

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Laparoscopic distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy

Histology:	Solid pseudopapillary neoplasm, 2.8cm, R0 resection margins, no lymphovascular invasion, pT1N0M0. Beta-catenin nuclear positive on immunohistochemistry.

Current Situation:	Post-operative follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today following her recent surgery for pancreatic solid pseudopapillary neoplasm. She has made an excellent recovery from her laparoscopic distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy performed on 15th January 2024. Her post-operative course was uncomplicated apart from mild pancreatic enzyme insufficiency which has responded well to Creon supplementation.

She reports good energy levels and has returned to her usual activities. Her appetite is normal and her weight is stable at 65kg. She denies any abdominal pain or gastrointestinal symptoms. Her wound sites have healed well.

On examination today, her laparoscopic port sites are well-healed with no evidence of infection or herniation. Her abdomen is soft and non-tender with no masses or organomegaly. Her performance status is 0.

I have reviewed her post-operative imaging which shows no evidence of residual disease. Given the complete resection and the typically indolent nature of solid pseudopapillary neoplasms, her prognosis is excellent. No adjuvant therapy is indicated.

The plan is for surveillance with 6-monthly CT imaging for the first two years, then annually thereafter. She has been prescribed lifelong penicillin V and received post-splenectomy vaccinations. I will arrange her next CT scan for July 2024 and see her afterwards with the results. She understands to contact us sooner if she develops any concerning symptoms.
